snippet: Andrew Talansky, one of the United States’ top road cyclists, never expected to spend the second half of the Tour de France watching the race from poolside in Spain.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column observes that Andrew Talansky, one of America's top road cyclists, has been forced to watch Tour de France from sidelines due to injury; commends Talansky's grit to finish out brutal 11th stage despite two crashes and respiratory infection; notes that 2014 Tour has been tough for many riders.
lead_paragraph: Andrew Talansky, one of the United States’ top road cyclists, never expected to spend the second half of the Tour de France watching the race from poolside in Spain.

headline.main: Before Leaving Tour de France, a Rider Displays a Champion’s Endurance
headline.print_headline: Before Withdrawing, a Rider Displays a Champion’s Endurance
